text: I'm thinking of trying to make some simple 2d games, but I've yet to choose a language.
A lot of people recommend either C++ with SDL or python with pygame.
I keep hearing that developement on C++ is fairly slow, and developement time with Python is fairly fast.
Anyways, could anyone elaborate on this?
What exactly makes development in C++ so time consuming?
The programs I've made have been Project Euler-style in that they're very short and math-based, so I have no experience in larger projects.
